summary: 1966  was a common year starting on Saturday of the Gregorian calendar.
full_text:
For the film of the same name, see The Devil's Brigade .
The 1st Special Service Force , was an elite American-Canadian commando unit in World War II, under command of the United States Fifth Army. The unit was organized in 1942 and trained at Fort William Henry Harrison near Helena, Montana in the United States. It fought in the Aleutian Islands, Italy, and southern France before being disbanded in December 1944.
The modern American and Canadian special operations forces trace their heritage to this unit. In 2013, the United States Congress passed a bill to award the 1st Special Service Force the Congressional Gold Medal.
title: The Devil's Brigade
